1900750.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900750
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 001
1900750.text: Qatada said; “I asked Anas ibn Malik: ‘How were the sandals of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace)?’ He said: ‘They had two thongs'.”

1900760.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900760
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 002
1900760.text: Ibn 'Abbas said: "The sandals of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) had two thongs with double laces.”

1900770.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900770
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 003
1900770.text: 'Isa ibn Tahman said: "Anas ibn Malik brought out to us a pair of hairless sandals with two thongs. Then Thabit told me afterwards, on the authority of Anas, that they were the sandals of the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace).”

1900780.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900780
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 004
1900780.text: 'Ubaid ibn Juraij said to Ibn 'Umar: "I saw you wearing the tanned ox-hide sandals with no hair on them [an-ni'al as-sibtiyya]." He replied: "I saw Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) wearing the sandals on which there is no hair, and he performed the minor ritual ablution in them, so I love to wear them!”

1900790.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900790
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 005
1900790.text: Abu Huraira said: "The sandals of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) had two thongs."

1900800.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900800
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 006
1900800.text: Amr ibn Huraith said: "I saw Allah's Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) performing the ritual prayer in sewn sandals.”

1900810.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900810
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 007
1900810.text: Abu Hurairah reports that Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): “Let none of you walk in a single sandal. Let him wear them both or take them both off!”

1900830.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900830
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 008
1900830.text: Jabir reported: “The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) forbade one (referring to the man) to eat with his left hand, or to walk in a single sandal.”

1900840.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900840
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 009
1900840.text: Abu Huraira said: “The Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace): "When one of you puts on sandals, let him begin with the right, and when he takes them off, let him begin with the left, for the right must be the first of them to be put on, and the last of them to be taken off.”

1900850.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900850
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 010
1900850.text: 'A’isha said: "Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) would love to start whatever he could on the right side, in his combing, his footwear and his purification.”

1900860.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900860
In-book reference  : Book 10, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 10, Hadith 011
1900860.text: Abu Huraira said: “The sandals of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) had two thongs, as did those of Abu Bakr and 'Umar (may Allah the Exalted be well pleased with them), and the first to tie a single knot was 'Uthman (may Allah be well pleased with him).”
